Title: New Escovopsis species from Argentina
Abstract:
Escovopsis is a genus in the Phylum Ascomycota, in the
Order Hypocreales, associated with fungus-growing ants. This genus was
proposed in 1990 to replace the genus Phialocladus and nowadays has
seven formally described species. In addition, several morphotypes have
been characterized for Escovopsis based on their conidial mass
coloration: brown, yellow, white and pink conidiated. Escovopsis
taxonomic studies are sparse and thus, there are still many questions to
be answered. The aim of this study is to describe new species of
Escovopsis found in Argentina using morphological and molecular
characters. We review and discuss the taxonomy of the genus and related
taxa. Herein, we describe five new species: E. longivesica, E.
pseudoweberi, E. catenulata, E. atlas and E. primorosea. Finally, we
evaluated the morphotypes based on conidia color by means of molecular
data to conclude that the brown conidiated clade belongs to the genus
Escovopsis (sensu stricto) and morphotypes with other colors represent
lineages warranting new taxonomic description.
